intro: Pyrus sudetica, commonly known as the Sudetic pear, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rosaceae. It is native to Central and Eastern Europe, particularly found in regions such as the Sudetes and surrounding areas. The plant is a deciduous shrub or small tree, typically reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a serrated margin, while its flowers are white or pale yellow, appearing in clusters. The fruit is a pome, similar to other pears, and is typically edible, though it may be less commonly cultivated than other pear species.
